content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Initializing an empty string to append extracted code blocks
    extracted_code = ""

    # Regular expression pattern to match code fences (3 backticks for julia language)
    julia_code_pattern = r"```julia\n([\s\S]*?)\n*```"m

    # Find all occurrences of the pattern in the markdown document
    for match in eachmatch(julia_code_pattern, md)
        # Extract the content inside the code fence
        content = strip(match.captures[1].string)

        # Append the extracted content to our final string
        extracted_code *= content * "\n"
    end

    # Return the concatenated and stripped string of all julia code blocks
    return stripped(extracted_code)
end
```
